subject: Marketing
title: The Spectrum of Deception
description: A quick win: understand The Spectrum of Deception.

hook.text: A burger in an ad looks nothing like the burger you receive. Is that fraud or just marketing?

buildup.text: Deception ranges from outright lies to exaggeration, omission, and misleading framing.

twist.text: The legal line is clear but the ethical line is blurrier. Legal doesn't always mean right.

climax.text: Consumers forgive exaggeration but punish outright deception with lasting brand damage.

punchline.text: Legal is the floor. Ethical is the ceiling.

quiz.question: What is the difference between puffery and deception in marketing?
options: Puffery is obvious exaggeration while deception misleads about facts
There is no legal difference between the two
Puffery is illegal in most countries
